title: Bard - Brainstorming

metadata.description: Learn about Bard - Brainstorming with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Using Bard to Brainstorm
Bard can't replace your creativity, but you can use it to give yourself new ideas and perspectives.
You can use Bard as someone who is always ready to brainstorm and can brainstorm just about anything!
Define the Topic
Before using Generative AI to help you, you should clarify the topic.
Are you starting a new business? Finding a name for a cat? In this example, we will brainstorm ideas for activities for a birthday party for five-year-old girls.
Ask Open-Ended Questions
Unlike when you ask Bard for something specific, it is important to keep it open-ended for brainstorming sessions. This will give you a wider range of responses:
Example
With the following prompt:
What are some unique ideas for activities for 10 five-year-old girls at a birthday party?
A response from Bard could be:
That is a good list of starting points. Let's narrow it down, then expand it further.
Follow-Ups with more Details
From the list above, let's move forward with ideas 2 and 4. Combine them into one for craft picnic!
To get more details, we can ask Bard to add unique details:
Example
With the following prompt:
Combine ideas 2 and 4. Make this into a unique experience that the children will remember.
A response from Bard could be:
Now that sounds like a good time!
Refine Further
Now we have our key idea, let's refine it further.
Example
With the following prompt:
How can we make this more social for the girls? I am worried they will lose interest, making it more difficult to organize. How can we make it more of a thing they do together?
A response from Bard could be:
That was an example of how you can start with a basic idea and, with the help of Bard, transform it into something unique.
